items.q: If you want to pass the final exam, you ____________________ (should / may) study tonight.
People under the age of 18 are prohibited from buying cigarettes, so you ____________________ (might / must) show your identification if you want to make a purchase.
When you see lightning nearby, you ____________________ (can / had better) find shelter immediately.
Theresa ____________________ (must not / may not) come to the movies with us because she's not sure if she has to go to work.
My car is making a very strange noise, so I ____________________ (can / had better) take it to a repair shop.
Luis needs help with his homework, so I told him that he ____________________ (must / could) come to my house and we can study together.
If you're trying to learn a new language, you ____________________ (may / ought to) try to practice it every day.
Students ____________________ (had better not / should not) cheat on tests; if the professor finds out, the students will get a zero grade.
We ____________________ (might / must) stop using oil if we want to reduce pollution.
If you want to do well on the test tomorrow, you ____________________ (can / had better) get enough sleep tonight.

Choose the best answer. a. Deforestation causes irreparable damage to the environment and should be stopped. b. Logging is a very profitable business. c. People can used cleared land to build homes and other structures.

Choose the best answer. a. Gun violence is a very serious issue. b. Victims of gun violence include all types of people, including young children and the elderly. c. In order to stop gun violence, the government must pass regulations that detail where and to whom weapons can be sold.

Choose the best answer. a. Homelessness is a growing problem in this city. b. The city should increase taxes and use the increased tax revenue to fund job training and other programs to support the homeless. c. There are fewer resources and programs available to help the homeless.

Choose the best answer. a. In order to prevent childhood obesity, schools should be given the right to ban foods and drinks that they deem unhealthy. b. Childhood obesity is a growing problem in the United States. c. Obesity can lead to many health problems and can have a negative impact on self-esteem.

Choose the best answer. a. Plagiarism is a very serious offense. b. Some students do not know the difference between citations and plagiarism. c. Students who are suspected of plagiarism should automatically receive a failing grade and should be permanently expelled from school.
an amendment a. to repair b. to keep the same c. to make a change
an excerpt a. a topic b. an idea c. a portion
antiquated a. old b. modern c. recent
fundamental a. funny b. important c. not important
outlawed a. free b. legal c. illegal
pivotal a. interesting b. important c. expensive
reluctant a. to want to do something b. to not want to do something c. to want to change something
to implement a. to put into effect b. to make legal c. to stop using
to take into account a. to take a vacation b. to recommend c. to consider
truancy a. politicians b. teachers c. students
These poor, endangered animals have no one to care for them.
It's been raining for ten days. Today I wore a yellow jacket, and the sun came out! So, whenever I want it to be sunny out, I'll wear something yellow.
Eating meat can be bad for your heart. Justin Timberlake, for example, never eats meat.
Ray gave flowers to both me and my sister. He must give flowers to everyone.
All children hate vegetables.
His CD will either be a big hit or it will never sell a single copy.
to be associated _____
to take _____ account
to be pivotal _____ the history of a country
to come _____ fire
to _____ arms
an excerpt _____ a book
to _____ changes
to be better _____
standard of _____
a sense _____ community
According to my doctor, stress can to induce asthma.
"Our country must be prepared to defend itself, the President declared yesterday.
"One in four Americans is overweight," the New York times reported Wednesday.
According to Mr. Boswell, "We must work with one other to resolve this problem"
The trainer of the Olympic swimmers say that he hopes they will win at least one gold medal this year.

Topic: Dependence on Computer Technology Pro thesis statement: Con thesis statement:

Topic: Extending the School Year by Two Months Pro thesis statement: Con thesis statement:
People sit on beach blankets, read, listen to music, and swim.
By the middle of the summer, however, some beaches are overcrowded with visitors and are covered in garbage that other people have left behind.
After many hours of the beach, you need to drink water to make sure you are not dehydrated.
You can watch people do water sports or fly a kite, while the lifeguards keep watch over the beach.
Doctors warn, however, that excessive exposure to the sun can cause skin damage and even lead to skin cancer.
Needless to say, the sound of the waves breaking on the shore is a calming sound for any beach visitor.
While it may be true that some video games cause children to become more violent, video games help children develop problem-solving skills and hand-eye coordination.

Although the Internet seems to allow you to communicate with people more frequently, studies show that face-to-face contact with family and friends is the most effective way to strengthen relationships.
Most people get information about news and current events on the Internet.
Although it is commonly believed that medication is the only way to cure an illness, doctors say that having a positive attitude and outlook can help speed up recovery.
The high cost of housing in this city means that many families cannot afford to live here.
